application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Boulder, CO, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Chicago, IL, USA
description:
Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools, technology, and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation, to manager training, to leadership development, and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal, social, a process, and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member, you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow, and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

You’d be joining the Learning Operations team, which works globally to advance scale, efficiency, and to improve the learning and developmental experiences of Googlers.

As the Learning Ops Data and Insights Manager, you’ll be responsible for ensuring PeopleDev has the data, insights, and capabilities to understand whether our learning experiences are achieving our key metrics (e.g., efficiency, quality, impact). You will work with a variety of stakeholders across both PeopleDev and People Operations (POps) to ensure they have the data they need, through self-service capabilities or direct support, to make Google a place to learn and grow. As you will be responsible for standing up this team and partnering with the Head of Learning Operations to set the strategy of data support across PeopleDev, you will be comfortable in an ambiguous environment and will want to work on and solve complex issues by working with and through partners and stakeholders. The role will continue to evolve and refine how we measure the impact of our Learning and Development programs and interventions, operations, and talent management capabilities.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or quantitative/business-oriented field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years relevant work as a data or evaluation professional.
  • Experience leading a technical team in a startup environment.
  • Experience in data manipulation using SQL and data visualization.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience designing learning evaluations, conducting data analysis and presenting findings to measure the efficiency, effectiveness and impact of learning experiences (e.g., classroom, online).
  • Excellent collaboration, influencing and relationship-building skills; ability to build strong relationships with cross-functional partners and influence senior leaders.
  • Strong critical thinking and exceptional problem solving skills – analysis, design, evaluation, explanation.
  • Ability to thrive in an environment with multiple cross-functional stakeholders with competing agendas by bringing people together to achieve a common goal.
responsibilities:
• Grow and lead a team of analysts with expertise in data analytics, reporting/dashboard design, and learning evaluation.
  • Develop and implement the data and evaluation strategy for PeopleDev, partnering closely with leaders and their respective teams in order to deliver solutions that fit their evolving needs and support scale.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with partners in other analytics teams across POps, ensuring PeopleDev understands and aligns with their evolving services.
  • Build and shape relationships with our internal PeopleDev partners, manage competing priorities and expectations. Play an active role in the Learning Ops leadership team, take initiative to execute on our mission, make tradeoffs, and push the team to grow and evolve.
  • Apply your expertise in data analytics and visualization to see beyond the numbers and show PeopleDev’s impact.
title: Learning Ops Data and Insights Manager, PeopleDev
